remarks: Lemma for ~ ist1-5 and similar theorems.  If ` A ` is a topological property which implies T_0, such as T_1 or T_2, the property can be "decomposed" into T_0 and a non-T_0 version of property ` A ` (which is defined as stating that the Kolmogorov quotient of the space has property ` A ` ).  For example, if ` A ` is T_1, then the theorem states that a space is T_1 iff it is T_0 and its Kolmogorov quotient is T_1 (we call this property R_0).  (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 25-Aug-2015.)
statement:
ist1-5lem.1 $e |- ( J e. A -> J e. Kol2 ) $.
ist1-5lem.2 $e |- ( J ~= ( KQ ` J ) -> ( J e. A -> ( KQ ` J ) e. A ) ) $.
ist1-5lem.3 $e |- ( ( KQ ` J ) ~= J -> ( ( KQ ` J ) e. A -> J e. A ) ) $.
ist1-5lem $p |- ( J e. A <-> ( J e. Kol2 /\ ( KQ ` J ) e. A ) ) $.
